But, many developers don't realise that the one thing that could make or break things even after the product is launched is user","media":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/2d86ed30b28211e8b2e7114aea10c711/border-1615871153810.png","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/2d86ed30b28211e8b2e7114aea10c711/border-1615871153810.png","defaultThumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/2d86ed30b28211e8b2e7114aea10c711/border-1615871153810.png","brandSpotlight":{"name":"AppsFlyer","slug":"appsflyer","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/images/brandSpotlight/Untitleddesign34-1615872000125.png"},"removeAds":true,"sponsoredStory":true,"isRegistrationRequired":false,"timeToRead":6,"tags":[]},"snippets":null,"trailers":null,"path":"/2021/03/onelink-helping-startups-drive-user-engagement-leveraging-deep-links","featured":true,"mobilePostJson":[{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"list":"bullet"},"data":"For most app developers the launch of their final product usually precedes an arduous journey of testing countless prototypes and securing funding, among other challenges. But, many developers don't realise that the one thing that could make or break things even after the product is launched is user traffic. There are few ways which are as effective in driving users to an app as owned media.\n\nOwned media typically refers to an app’s presence on mediums like social media, email lists, websites, blogs, newsletters and catalogues. When combined with user acquisition tools, owned media channels can help startups drive installations by users who are most likely to engage with the app and generate revenue. However, many startups are often discouraged from fully leveraging the potential of owned media due to broken user journeys. App marketing firm AppsFlyer’s OneLink tool bridges this gap and enables startups to direct users to their app by using deep linking and owned media.\n\nA common example of a broken user experience would be when a user clicks on an ad that's supposed to lead them to an app, but it leads them to an irrelevant page or one that flashes an error message. This might be because of several reasons, some of which are:\n\nThe app’s design might be siloed or fragmented.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"list":"bullet"},"data":"Users being directed from multiple platforms, multiple devices, operating systems (iOS, Android, Windows, etc.), software versions, and many media channels.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"list":"bullet"},"data":"Users being denied entry beyond the home screen. Regular app links cannot route users to in-app content, but only to the default home screen.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\nOneLink is a single link for brands to provide their users an optimal experience, irrespective of the device, operating system, media channel, or the platform they use.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"Opportunities galore \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Using regular links is often the norm for increasing user traffic. But in a complex and fragmented mobile ecosystem, such links often lead to a broken user experience.\n\nBy leveraging the power of owned media with the help of tools like AppsFlyer’s OneLink, startups can expect their conversion to grow by 2x to 5x through expanded user acquisition, driving engagement and increasing activation rates by providing app users personalised experiences.\n\nMoreover, when owned media channels are leveraged with deep links — which leads users to an app instead of a website — they can create seamless ‘web-to-app’ journeys. When used with an owned media channel like email lists, it can ensure smooth ‘email-to-app’ journeys as well, apart from driving organic growth from social media.\n\nThe problem with using regular links is that it can lead to broken user experience, even in mobile media channels like QR codes and SMS and push notifications. The complex and fragmented nature of the mobile ecosystem requires a third-party technology to ensure that users can access content without any glitches.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"Seamless user experience that drives engagement\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"list":"bullet"},"data":"Deep linking tools are critical for startups’ growth and their ability to drive user acquisition. As more and more companies expand their digital footprint to grow, they are always looking to attribute and track sources of user traffic — a task that can easily be completed with OneLink. AppsFlyer's OneLink allows marketers to create a single link that can automatically detect each users' platform and app state, i.e. if it's installed or not, and sends them to either the website or app page.\n\nDeep linking is crucial not just for paid media but also for owned media channels like email lists, webpages, and SMS as well. In addition to mobile attribution and deep linking, attribution providers also provide first party audience segmentation, fraud protection, advanced analytics, and, depending on the provider, people-based attribution to connect customer touchpoints across the web, apps, and TV.\n\nAs a cost-effective tool to help startups cash in on the impact of deep linking on owned media channels, OneLink has a host of advantages that digital entrepreneurs would find useful. Some of these are:\n\nSimplifying growth and acquisition with a single link that works with every owned media channel or platform\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"list":"bullet"},"data":"Maximises ROI on owned media and engaging users with contextual experiences, which are powered by rich user data contained in deep links\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"list":"bullet"},"data":"A powerful trigger point called ‘Smart Banners’. Customisable and easy to create, these creative banners can be easily published on mobile web pages, and marketers can quickly turn their websites into effective sources for user acquisition. As they lead users to the right content, irrespective of the operating system, device, or browser the former may be using, they can churn out accurate insights for marketers.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\nThe mechanics of zero budget marketing can be slightly tricky to master. With OneLink, startups can ensure that they cash in the benefits of zero budget marketing to push user traffic. One of the key ways in which it helps startups implement zero budget marketing strategies is that it simplifies growth and user acquisition with a single link that works on any channel or platform. Next, emerging brands can leverage their assets and maximise their ROI on owned media channels. It also enables personalised onboarding, leaving users delighted with a contextual experience and optimises conversions.\n\nWhether you're an app developer with limited resources or a marketer at a leading brand, the time is right to master the new approach of zero budget marketing via deep linking. Simply put, the success of a startup’s business growth and customer retention strategy may very well depend on the maximisation of owned channels (alongside paid), while significantly minimising marketing costs.\n\nOwned media typically refers to an app’s presence on mediums like social media, email lists, websites, blogs, newsletters and catalogues. When combined with user acquisition tools, owned media channels can help startups drive installations by users who are most likely to engage with the app and generate revenue. However, many startups are often discouraged from fully leveraging the potential of owned media due to broken user journeys. App marketing firm "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true,"link":"http://bit.ly/3eKb7eG"},"data":"AppsFlyer’s OneLink"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" tool bridges this gap and enables startups to direct users to their app by using deep linking and owned media.\n\n"}},{"contentType":"divider","value":{}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n"}}],"timeLapsed":"16th Mar 2021","publishedDate":"March 16, 2021"}]},{"type":"ad","id":"ojvievejj","hideOnTakeover":false,"slot":"/154555149/ys_bilbrd_all_pg_btf","size":[[970,250],[970,90]],"display":{"mobileSmall":false,"mobileMedium":false,"mobileLarge":false,"tablet":true,"desktop":true},"background":"#ffffff"},{"type":"ad","id":"vhdfbvdhfvh","hideOnTakeover":false,"slot":"/154555149/ys_en_hmpage_rhs_rctngle","size":[300,250],"display":{"mobileSmall":true,"mobileMedium":true,"mobileLarge":true,"tablet":false,"desktop":false},"background":"#ffffff"},{"type":"content","title":"Latest Stories","subtitle":"Latest published stories, interviews, and updates across YourStory properties","dataAttribute":"latest","clickCTA":"/latest","clickText":"See More","cardType":"RegularHorizontalCard","containerType":"RegularHorizontal","dataAPI":"/api/v2/yshome/stories/latest?limit=12&skipFeatured=true&skipDontShowOnHomepage=true&greedy=true","logo":"https://images.yourstory.com/assets/icons/ic_new.svg","discoverPath":"/search","data":[{"id":195723,"title":"From inspiration to impact: presenting YourStory’s premium subscription product - skills.\n\n","publishedAt":"2021-03-21T14:02:49.896Z","updatedAt":"2021-03-21T14:36:29.769Z","brand":{"name":"HerStory","slug":"herstory","locale":"en_GB","path":"/herstory"},"metadata":{"authors":[{"name":"Rekha Balakrishnan","username":"rekha-balakrishnan","order":0,"path":"/author/rekha-balakrishnan"}],"category":{"id":660,"name":"Women Entrepreneur","slug":"women-entrepreneur","path":"/herstory/category/women-entrepreneur"},"excerpt":"Shreyasi Singh is the co-founder of Harappa Education, an online learning institute that offers 25 courses on cognitive, social, and behavioural skills.","media":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/4/2d86ed30b28211e8b2e7114aea10c711/ShreyasiSingh-1616332467447.png","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/4/2d86ed30b28211e8b2e7114aea10c711/ShreyasiSingh-1616332467447.png","defaultThumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/4/2d86ed30b28211e8b2e7114aea10c711/ShreyasiSingh-1616332467447.png","brandSpotlight":{"name":"WhatsApp","slug":"whatsapp","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/images/brandSpotlight/Untitleddesign31-1614916955962.png"},"removeAds":true,"sponsoredStory":true,"isRegistrationRequired":false,"timeToRead":4,"tags":[]},"snippets":null,"trailers":null,"path":"/herstory/2021/03/journalism-entrepreneurship-setting-standards-harappa-education","featured":false,"mobilePostJson":[{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"As a journalist for over a decade, Shreyasi Singh worked across different types of media outlets –news agencies, print, and broadcast. Her stint as editor of "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Inc, "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"the iconic American magazine on entrepreneurship, gave her what she calls a “PhD in entrepreneurship”.\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"“It was very interesting to meet so many entrepreneurs, hear their stories and things they have fought for. All the amazing ideas, culture, and productivity that I was seeing made me think that If I were a CEO, I would do this. I think that immersion into entrepreneurship was the beginning of my own journey,” says the Co-founder of Harappa Education."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"In 2015, she decided she would not go back to journalism full time, and started working with Pramath Raj Sinha, now her co-founder, on The Vedica Scholars Programme for Women, an 18-month full-time, post-graduate management programme.\n"}},{"contentType":"image","value":{"src":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/4/8e7cc4102d6c11e9aa979329348d4c3e/Imagek63d-1616334773150.jpg"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"After Vedica, she wanted to work on something from the ground up. She started having conversations with Pramath and the idea of Harappa came into being.\n\nThey spent six months doing extensive research on online education and understanding the edtech industry. One of the decisions they made was to create a curriculum and not just become a marketplace.\n\nAs an edtech entrepreneur, technology plays a major role in Shreyasi’s life and work. She believes it is an immensely powerful tool for professionals to create their personal brand. “I don’t think women professionals need to limit themselves to only networking groups with women, although those are critical and deeply empowering, but must use social media to amplify and expand their professional networks overall. On social media, you have the power to shape your narrative; and my advice to women professionals would be to learn how to do this with consistency and flair. It’s the most cost-effective way of standing out, but it requires skill and discipline,” she adds.\n\nShreyasi says she cannot imagine running her life and business without WhatsApp. “I value the speed it facilitates, and the easy way to create group-based forums for chat that can be created in a second. I have tried other collaboration tools but the speed and the super-intuitive user interface that one has got so used to makes it difficult to build a habit beyond WhatsApp,” Shreyasi says.\n\nHarappa Education was incorporated in March 2018 and started launching its courses in May 2019. Essentially, Harappa is an online learning institution that offers 25 courses on cognitive, social, and behavioural skills that employers crave at the workplace. The courses are around five hours long, and are self-paced and asynchronous. \n\nHarappa has a 60-member team, at the convergence of the world of work and academics, delivering rich and contextualised content that is tailored to 21st century learners.  \n\nIt works on a B2B model, with campuses and corporates. It has not launched a B2C model yet. In the campus space, it works with IIT Gandhinagar, Punjab Engineering college, and Lovely Professional University. It also works with 12 corporates, including leading brands across IT, FMCG, and financial services. In January 2020, James Murdoch-led Lupa Systems invested in Harappa in a seed funding round.\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"“Harappa’s unique curriculum of ‘5 Habits and 25 Skills’ is delivered through an engaging online-first approach. It addresses a core gap in education: the cognitive (how to think, reason, and problem-solve), social (how to communicate, influence, and build relationships), and behavioural (how to grow, act, and lead) — skills that employers crave at the workplace,” Shreyasi says."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Shreyasi believes the “new normal” will require everyone to build different skills and behaviours. “Change will be a big skill that each one of us is going to need and I think that our courses can help,” she adds.\n"}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"This Bengaluru-based home chef is using WhatsApp groups to popularise home-made food","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/4/2d86ed30b28211e8b2e7114aea10c711/Image3uxo-1614940898894.jpg?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/herstory/2021/03/bengaluru-home-chef-whatsapp-food"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"This story is part of a series spotlighting extraordinary, inspiring women from different walks of life for the See Us, Hear Us campaign powered by WhatsApp for International Women’s Day. is the story of how one WhatsApp message became the impetus for a movement. 1MillionMeals — an initiative of Apne Aap Women Worldwide — has now become a metaphor for millions of meals distributed to marginalised families ever since the first lockdown was announced in March last year.\n\n"}},{"contentType":"image","value":{"src":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/4/8e7cc4102d6c11e9aa979329348d4c3e/Image89ol-1616334530649.jpg","caption":"\u003cp>Ruchira Gupta with her kijiye, hum log bhooke hai, humhe khaana nahin mil raha hai.” (Sister, do something, we don’t have any food, and are starving).\u003c/em>"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"The girl was the daughter of a sex worker who was sent home from boarding school due to the lockdown. She was one of the many children sponsored by Apne Aap — an organisation that helps victims of sex trafficking and children in many parts of India.\n\nAfter the panic call, Ruchira immediately reached out to a friend to arrange for 500 quick meals to be delivered and distributed in that particular area.\n\nSoon, she started getting messages from Bihar, Kolkata, and other places, from women and children who were starving. They had sold off everything to feed their children, and the situation was not going to change anytime soon.\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"“Since then, I have used WhatsApp to run the world’s biggest food drive for victims of sex trafficking during the COVID-19 pandemic. I used to get messages from survivors about the food they needed, where they needed it, and mobilise students and volunteers to deliver food. I was able to establish human chains from factory owners to girls in brothels via WhatsApp,” says Ruchira."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"A circle of giving and receiving\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Ruchira says she ran the 1Million Meals campaign through WhatsApp by establishing several control rooms or boiler rooms on the platform. “I was also able to verify that the food had reached by asking beneficiaries to send me photos on WhatsApp, show donors the need and the impact, and guide volunteers all using the platform,” she adds.\n\nFrom cooked meals, the campaign moved to the distribution of dry rations that included a bag of rice, onions, dal, potatoes, spices, soap, cooking oils, and other essentials.\n\nHelp came from different quarters — small scale businesses and merchants were ready to pitch in with just a call. The initiative spread through word-of-mouth, and later, celebrities like Chef Vikas Khanna and actor Abhay Deol amplified it on social media.\n\nWithin 100 days, the initiative crossed over five million meals, and the journey still continues.\n\nThe 1MillionMeals food drive has been a lifeline for over 50,000 vulnerable women and children during the pandemic, literally ensuring life over death.\n\n“Some did not commit suicide as a result. Others did not starve. It kept children studying with full stomachs. We crossed our targets five times over. Our aim was one million meals for 100 days for 10,000 women and children. We were able to reach more than five million meals to 50,000 women and children. We plan to continue for 500 days till every last girl is vaccinated,” Ruchira says.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Life-changing documentary\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"During her career as a journalist, Ruchira travelled to Nepal and visited villages with missing girls, kidnapped and forced into prostitution. These experiences became the focus of her documentary — "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"The Selling of Innocents —"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" in 1996, on the lives of these women in brothels in different parts of India, which also won her an Emmy Award.\n\n“I went to brothels in Bihar, Kolkata, and Mumbai, and would see a girl as young as 13, forced to have sex with someone who was 40. Pimps and other people were exploiting them as well,” she recalls.\n\nApne Aap’s business plan is based on the four dreams of women: education for their children, having a room of their own (independent and safe housing), a job in an office, and justice.\n\n“After food, we have to think of livelihoods and education. I took a month-and-half to complete them, painting at my own pace,” she says.\n\nA few of her relatives who came to visit her wanted to buy them all. The market is super big, and demand is even bigger. Beyond this growth, customers, and new products, the fundraising field is new to us, and hence we are sceptical. And, when we are sceptical, we delay the decision, and we potentially might even lose the opportunity. \n\nSo I am writing this for those who are entering into that new fundraising field, those who are looking for their first cheque, and I want to tell you that an early-stage VC is more than just the first cheque. In any way, I could add a little value to your startup on what to expect from early-stage VCs, I would consider this mission accomplished. \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Where to start\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"I started by sending pitch decks after pitch decks. Though I know that sending pitch decks to the ‘contact us’ tab of a potential VC or angel groups websites might not serve its full purpose, I kept doing that, consistently. \n\nI applied to any pitch fest that I came across and started giving pitches. Some filtered us out in the application stage, some in the first round, and a few in the second round. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Sometimes this even makes you think, \"Is it worth this much time?” Now close to eight months later, I can say, “Yes. it is worth it! Totally worth it!”"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"All you need is just one investor to propel you, and to get into the eyes of that one believer, you may need to click on hundreds of ‘contact us’ or may even have to send out more emails. \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Enter 100X.VC\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Right after giving a pitch at one of the prominent fora in my home town, I received an email that 100X wants to talk to me. I was excited. One meeting leads to another and then to another, and another.\n\nThe screening process of 100X was of multiple levels. When the VC was asking for more data, I was blindly sharing all that was available. Finally, after four rounds of e-meetings, here I am, sitting in their Mumbai office, between the COVID-19 pandemic, awaiting my final lap of pitch fest (or is there any more coming?) \n"}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"The story of a startup born in the middle of a pandemic and how it got its first cheque from 100X.VC","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/11718bd02d6d11e9aa979329348d4c3e/Imagem2hi-1615641848356.jpg?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2021/03/startup-born-in-the-middle-of-pandemic-accio-robotics-100x-vc"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"The learnings\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"100X.VC dissected every part of the scale-up model we had planned and asked us why we want to proceed in a specific way, and not the other way? Why this model, why not the other model. Why offline sales? \n\nThose 40 minutes of the meeting gave me much more clarity on the path forward than we had envisioned by ourselves in the last two years. \n\nI hardly knew what was awaiting was a sprint of real transformational events through a series of masterclasses they offer. When we talk about an early-stage investor or a seed-stage investor, they offer more than funding. I am not sure if many people are aware of the real deal with 100X. For startups, 100X’s masterclasses are the real deal. \n\nI remember searching for an industry specialist for getting some guidance for a lot of blind areas where we fumbled, but when your investor offers it in a structured manner, that too one-on-one with industry veterans, you may want to pinch yourself to verify if this is real. \n\nAll of a sudden, we had direct access to a lot of people, and they are available to address your queries instantaneously. Sessions after sessions, our confidence was getting stronger and our vision getting clearer. There are two reasons for it. \n\nFirst, when an industry person talks about what we have envisioned for execution, it confirms our thought process was right. That gives us confidence that we are on the right path. Second, when they share their experience, we see ourselves through that experience, and we can expect what possibly could come up and be prepared.\n\nNot even a single session passed without a great takeaway, and it might be a little overwhelming for a startup in the early stage. I couldn’t imagine that a person like Mitesh Shah was explaining the pricing strategy. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"“If you start discounting, then that develops into a habit… Have a mid to long-term plan, especially for pricing,” he said."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"When we designed our pricing, we also outlined our plans for the next 18 months in terms of pricing for each SKUs. This boosted our confidence further.\n\nThe masterclasses cover various verticals of a startup. We have product development sessions, where Venkat Rajan talks about the importance of not overdoing your solution or ensuring you are not solving the wrong problem. \n\nShanti Mohan’s sessions brought in a completely new perspective for the hiring process. We saw a profusion of information in that particular session.\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"“Hire like a startup… Evaluate on potential, measure on attitude, and hire for skill,” she said."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"While I introspect on that, I realise, since founders work 14-15 hours a day, it will be a complementing to find someone who brings equal work ethics to the table.\n\nIn fact, these sessions are a great way to validate your scale-up plans. Giri Giridhar helped us verify that a higher gross margin gives flexibility and validates our hypothesis. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"“Allow everyone to be brutal about what works and what not works with your business,” he said."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"The masterclasses also help redefine your communication with the consumer. I cannot thank Ambi Parameswaran enough, as he listens to each pitch and understands the business, and prompts us to think in terms of brand positioning. That impact was huge. Ambi, you play a crucial role in bringing more clarity to our brand positioning. \n\nWe also had a highly candid and pragmatic session by Vikram Chachra. However, the fundraising will be complete only when the entrepreneur starts thinking like an angel investor or VC, and why should an investor invest in the startup? \n\nUnderstanding how investment groups work will help a startup founder to appreciate the efforts investors put in. When Ravindra Krishnappa outlined the VCs story and how they work, that prompted all of us to realign ourselves. \n\nWhile Vishesh Rajaram reinstates the point that successful companies hire really well, he reminded us that we need to hire twice better. \n\nThe fundraising session was highly informative for startups starting to raise funds. Our session with Japan Vyas was very insightful in understanding when to raise funds and how much. His suggestions on fundraising are very strong. He said,\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"“Raise money when it is available and not when it is needed. More money never killed anyone.” "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"All the insights and key points for pitching were gold — understanding your target listener, the importance of the first few minutes of your pitch, and controlling the narrative. While that is a distant dream, I can't explain how much elated we were when talking to KRS Jamwal, listening to his viewpoints about our business. \n\nInvestors have a thesis and a framework in their mind for a startup evaluation. From an investors standpoint, Sajith Pai outlined a great framework. \n\nWhat is your ‘Reason to play, reason to win, brand persona, and GTM?’ Successful pitches create hooks in investors' minds for each of these verticals.\n"}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"[YS Learn] Top tips for startup founders while building an MVP ","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/a9efa9c02dd911e9adc52d913c55075e/founder-collage-1615827184525.png?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2021/03/ys-learn-top-tips-startup-founders-while-building-mvp-deepak-abott"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Conclusion\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"While I am writing this, I realise how much we have transformed in that span of a month. As his father was a bank official, the family was usually on the move. In 1989, they settled in Nashik. In 1999, Piyush left for Pune to pursue engineering. When he had completed his degree, his family urged him to start a business, but he did not trust their judgement right away. He took up a job at a manufacturing company in Mumbai, but later moved back to Nashik to work in the IT sector, as his income did not support his stay in Mumbai."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\nIn November 2003, Piyush, then 23, decided to start a small web hosting support business with seven friends. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"A partner’s mother happened to run a kindergarten centre in the city, so she offered the space to Piyush and his team to run the business after the children left. Piyush agreed. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"He brought his personal computer and his friends, too, brought a few computers from home and installed them in the kindergarten room. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"A year later, Ravindra’s brother, PJ Reddy, joined the company to handle its finances."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\nToday, it is a leader in the nuclear, defence, and aerospace equipment space, with domestic clients such as ISRO, Nuclear Power Corporation of India Limited, and Defence Research and Development Organisation, and overseas ones such as Bloom Energy, Dassault Aviation, and Elbit Systems. “We have over "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"400 machines, including 160-plus CNC (computer numerical control) machines "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"spread across seven units,” says P Srinivas Reddy, Managing Director and Ravindra Reddy’s son. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n“In FY 2020, our"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":" revenue"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" from operations was "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Rs 213.8 crore, "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"our order book size was Rs 345 crore, and our gross profits were 66.2 percent,” says Srinivas Reddy. This was leading to a gap.” "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"The brothers were always in the factory, trying to improve the existing items, but didn’t know what was selling in the market. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\nTheir businesses reached a dead end and they had to shut shop. However, this was the beginning of another eventful journey."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\nSachin says that while selling was their weakness, manufacturing became their strength. What made you take to film-making? \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Nikkhil Advani (NA): I'm the product of middle-class upbringing in the 70s and 80s. Going to the cinema, purchasing tickets in black from touts, eating soggy masala popcorn, sitting on foldable make-shift chairs in the aisle only to catch a few hours with our reel "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"hero"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" Amitabh Bachchan, was the ultimate reward for doing well in exams or  winning medals in sports. \n\nThose were simple joys that translated into what then seemed like an unattainable dream - to work in the films. I guess I also had a flair for spinning yarns and storytelling, marvelling my friends with fantastical tales. Looking back, I should have known how my life would turn out.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YSW: What was the turning point of your career? Were your parents supportive of the idea? \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"NA: Having graduated with a B.Sc in Chemistry from St. Xavier’s College, I was in the process of securing admission to universities in the US, when my then-girlfriend, now-wife and partner for life, Suparna Gupta, triggered some soul-searching discussions. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"I knew I wanted to direct; and I knew I lacked formal training. But I knew I had to give the struggle a shot. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Somewhere the cushion of an education to fall back on made the decision easier. My late mother, an advertising professional, was almost instantly supportive. My father, an engineer by qualification and a pharma professional, took some time to be convinced that I was on the right path. \nYSW: How have you seen yourself evolve over the years - from directing "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Kal Ho Na Ho "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"to now a web-series? What are the few changes that you have undergone in both your personal and professional life?  \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"NA: The struggle is real. Make no mistake. And it is eternal. \n \nIn varied degrees at different times, everyone in this industry has a journey where they pay a price, hoping for more and settling for less. It sounds philosophical. \n \nAfter almost three decades in this field, I can tell you that every morning I wake up to the same struggle, and hope that the compromises I need to make as a director, as a writer, as a producer, are somewhere mitigated by the alibi of past successes. Sometimes it all comes together, sometimes it doesn’t. The key is to keep going on. \n \nFor me personally, the big win has been that over time, I have earned the right to have my own voice as a filmmaker, to balance the compromises to fulfil the needs of my company while also being allowed to indulge my wants. On ground, the role played by technology in transforming how we make our films and shows, and how we reach our audiences, fascinates me. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"I am an eternal learner. Humility to accept you don’t know everything, is most critical to survive the struggle, the journey."}},{"contentType":"image","value":{"src":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/7/3fb20ae02dc911e9af58c17e6cc3d915/AAP8071CC1-1616152770155.jpg"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YSW: What led to the inception of Emmay Entertainment? What do you aspire to do through your production house? \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"NA: I was driven by two goals. After parting ways with Dharma Productions, I kept seeking a production partner who embodied the vision and strengths of my mentor, the late "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Yash Johar"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":". No one came close. To channel my experiences and learnings from him became the first goal. \n \nThe second goal: I wanted to create a "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"campus-like workplace where first-time-out, yet-to-succeed directors could find a launch pad"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":". To realise these goals, I knew I could not do this myself. Fortunately, around the same time, my sister, Monisha Advani, and our childhood friend, Madhu Bhojwani, had just exited a very successful corporate HR business through an acquisition. They had no exposure to the film business. However, they were highly regarded for their business acumen and integrity in the corporate world. It seemed like an unlikely match at the time. A decade later, I think the three of us feel it was meant to be.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YSW: Where do you seek inspiration from for your movies? \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"NA: I read a lot. I also observe the world around me. I am blessed with strong personalities for friends and family. \n \nConversations around politics and human rights is commonplace in my daily diet. All this forms a repository of information that I have access to. Eventually, it all comes down to human stories, where emotions are triggered, outcomes are fascinating. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Reflecting on the body of work I’m most proud of, it somewhere echoes the cause of the underdog, whom I try to champion in the films we make."}},{"contentType":"image","value":{"src":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/7/3fb20ae02dc911e9af58c17e6cc3d915/eknfklfe-1616153632346.jpg"}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"Lights, camera, entrepreneurship: catch actor, entrepreneur Kunal Kapoor at TechSparks 2020","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/3fb20ae02dc911e9af58c17e6cc3d915/Image64r0-1603209217003.jpg?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2020/10/social-tech-crowdfunding-startup-ketto-kunal-kapoor"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YSW: Most of your films are based on real-life events. How do you manage to merge the real and the reel - the fiction with the reality? \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"NA: One of my biggest learnings has been to recognise the often-underestimated intelligence of our audiences. Without intending to sound patronising, the worst words we can say as creators, is ‘dumb down’ the content.  \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"I think while the grammar can be modified in storytelling, the essence of authenticity, even in fiction, is something audiences look for, and can sense when it is absent. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" Authenticity, for me, can be found even in fantastical, larger-than-life stories -- where superheroes come together to fight a villain whose motivation is to punish a planet of inhabitants who have run amuck, causing natural disasters of herculean proportions. \n \nCloser to home, I drive my content development team to extensively research premises, engage subject matter experts where necessary and possible. Interestingly though, when my writers Ritesh Shah and Suresh Nair wrote "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"D-Day"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":", we did a fact-check post locking the script. Former Chiefs of RAW were consulted in the process and they found it incredible how close we were to the real facts on the ground. The coincidence was chilling. It somewhere vindicated that life and art do imitate one another!\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YSW: Do you tend to get very involved with the films that you make? If yes, how do you deal with the post-production hangover? \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"NA: Accountability to all our stakeholders is the primary driver. First, to the audience, who buy tickets and subscriptions to watch the content we create, then the funders and platforms. Next, our cast and crew. And finally, my partners and home team. Each second of cinema or web shows needs to justify the expectations of each of these beneficiaries. So yes, I am completely involved to the extent that I ensure we are delivering on these promises. \n \nHowever, being a director myself, I am extremely conscious of not imposing my creative vision or interpretation on other directors. My advice is there for them to consume, apply, or discard. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":" The best analogy I can give to explain my presence is that rails in a bowling alley that come up to avoid the ball from going into the gutter and coming as close as possible to a nine-pin strike! "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Early misses and failures have taught me one thing - to not rest on the laurels of a Friday, nor drown in the disappointment it can bring. My team and I work from Monday to Monday, which gives us a sense of being committed to creating a workflow that goes beyond the arrogance of an individual project, to ensure we put our teams to work every day, to grow those teams, to keep scaling and building. The only hangover I fear is not having work.\n"}},{"contentType":"image","value":{"src":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/7/3fb20ae02dc911e9af58c17e6cc3d915/AAP8008CC-1616153380078.jpg"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"YSW: What were the few challenges of shooting "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Mumbai Diaries"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"? \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"NA: "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Mumbai Diaries "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"has been a passion project for me personally. Having lived through the ordeal as an affected citizen, the chilling events have never mitigated in impact. The DNA of my city has been lauded, dissected, even chastised for being transactional for the manner in which it resiliently bounces back to normalcy. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"When I conceived this show, I wanted to highlight that our exterior often masks the inner demons and human challenges we face, living through the pace and problems of life in Mumbai. Little did I realise that the very same first responders we are highlighting in our show, would become the spine of the battle against COVID-19. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Production-wise, I am grateful that "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Amazon Prime "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"backed my vision and that has enabled us to recount the events of 26/11 through a very different set of lenses. Fortunately most of the show was shot pre-COVID-19 and we are now waiting at the starting gates to share this with audiences. \nYSW: What are your plans with "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Mumbai Diaries"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"? What is the message that you want to convey through the web series? \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"NA: I believe the objective of every work of art, content, is to entertain. That is also the objective of"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":" Mumbai Diaries 26/11"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":". Somewhere along the way, I hope it will make us recognise the untold un-celebrated human stories of our first responders who actually make Mumbai the maximum city that never sleeps.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YSW: How has directing a web series been different from directing a movie? \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"NA: Directing a film versus directing a show can be likened to running a sprint versus a marathon.\n \nBoth are physically and mentally challenging, but they make a different ask in terms of inputs from the athlete. I do not believe I have a playbook to refer to or one that I can finitely say works. It is a constant learning process and the feedback systems in place for reading the consumer are only getting more and more refined. \n \nIt is fascinating to see how science is leading art in current times. \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YSW: How do you think film direction and production are similar to entrepreneurship? \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"NA: Entrepreneurship is about identifying a consumer need that is yet to be served; finding an innovative way to maximise available inputs to create an optimum output that triggers action from that consumer. It is a horizontal that is applicable to every aspect of life, to varying degrees. \n\nA filmmaker is therefore an entrepreneur too. How good an entrepreneur you are really depends on the report card of our output.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YSW: Do you think the hype OTT has received in the last one year will affect how India consumes entertainment in the longer run? \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"NA: OTTs or OCCPs are not a hype. It would be shallow for us to see any form of technology that has managed to directly impact over five billion consumers worldwide as a hype. It is a form of infrastructure, akin to roads that take us physically to different destinations, depending on our needs and desires. \n \nI believe it is transformative in that personal device consumption now captures over 70 percent of mindshare of the five-billion population. As content creators, we must appreciate the shrinking of the six degrees of separation between ourselves and our consumers. Place a value on the feedback of choices made that artificial intelligence sends our way. And start telling stories in ways that we have the maximum impact. \n \nThe pandemic has altered the way we shop, the way we travel and the way we work. But mostly, it has changed the way we seek entertainment. This is habit forming. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"As storytellers, this is a renaissance of sorts, to be able to, like water, take the shape of so many diverse formats this infrastructure allows us."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YSW: What next for you - what are the other films in your pipeline? \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"NA: In 2021, watch out for "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Mumbai Diaries 26/11"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":","}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":" Sardar Ka Grandson"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":", "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Satyameva Jayate 2"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":","}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":" Bell Bottom"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":", "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Mughals"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":", "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Rocket Boys, "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"and "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Kaun Banegi Shikharwati"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":". \n \nEmmay Entertainment is 10 years old. We are proud of what we have achieved and grateful to the audiences that allow us to keep coming back to work every day. It’s a Monday today and I can tell you this - there are movies being made, web series being shot and stories being developed. He was earlier the CEO of Aster Hospitals and Clinics (GCC); Regional Director, Fortis Healthcare; Head-Brands, Wockhardt Hospitals; and GM at the Apollo Hospitals. \n\nThe Intrapreneurship Conclave — held virtually this week — helps companies focus on "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"employee creativity"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" and a vibrant culture of experimentation. The two-day event features 12 sessions and 22 speakers, who represent 19 companies. \n\nKarthik joins us in this "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"interview"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" on how his organisation built up morale during uncertain times, encouraged creative ideas, leveraged technology, and carried out continuous training.\n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true,"italic":true},"data":"Edited excerpts below:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"YourStory"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" [YS]:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":" "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"What were some ways you built up morale in the company during the lockdown and WFH days?\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Karthik Rajagopal [KR]: "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"The pandemic severely tested the resolve and resilience of all organisations, and hospitals have been no exception. We, in fact, had an added dimension given the need to be in the frontline of dealing with the virus. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Unlike many other sectors, work from home (WFH) was not an option for healthcare providers. Ensuring the safety and morale of doctors, nurses, and technicians have been a key additional challenge for hospitals. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Our healthcare staff functioned way beyond their normal working hours and were also required to "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"manage new responsibilities"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" that did not have defined protocols. Hence, the challenges faced by the healthcare industry were significantly different from other sectors. A few focus areas helped us sail through these turbulent times with the employees, as described below.\n"}},{"contentType":"image","value":{"src":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/28b451402d6a11e9aa979329348d4c3e/IMG06-1615277340558.png"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"1"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":". "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Flattened leadership structure:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" It is one of the key factors that drives an employee is the role he or she plays in reaching the organisation’s goal. It’s essential to believe in the purpose and take ownership. We allowed our employees to participate and take the responsibility for the outcomes in the assigned task force. While this measure helped us to build a sense of responsibility among the employees, we also experienced much better outcomes.\n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"2. Managing the speed of execution:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":" With the clinical and non-clinical processes and protocols changing every day, it became crucial for us to continuously learn and understand the situation on-ground, and accordingly implement new ideas that could improve our swiftness in performing. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"The senior management was present on-ground to understand the nitty-gritty of operations and worked towards solving the new challenges."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"3. Enhanced employee connect:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" The senior leadership team constantly engaged with the employees on-ground and listened to their challenges and opinions. This engagement created a sense of togetherness among the employees. Each employee felt the genuine care and our firm’s support for their welfare.\n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"4. Encouraged creative ideas:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" Employees were placed at the forefront to introduce ideas that could handle the challenges at hand. Brainstorming sessions were conducted consistently every day to attain better ideas to manage the situation, as hospitals had to continue the treatment for regular non-COVID patients and also manage COVID patients in a separate isolation ward. \n"}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"[Year in Review 2020] Here are the Top 5 Pivot and Persist stories about startups that changed their business models amidst COVID-19 \n","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/fd6b2ee0c6f411e8af1c974e95f3b2db/shutterstock1207152979-1590084243782.jpg?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2020/12/year-in-review-2020-top-5-pivot-and-persist-startup-stories"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"5. Improved access to resources and data:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":" The onset of the pandemic saw the rapid development in data and government protocols such as the use of face masks, travel cancellations, and screening of employees and patients. It was imperative for us to instantly adopt all the required measures and stay updated about the latest developments. Since the traditional model of data was limited, decision making on a new set of data played a critical role. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"For instance, there was a need to allocate and use PPE where recommendations changed rapidly based on PPE availability, disease prevalence, and emerging knowledge of viral transmission. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"We made provisions to ensure all the requirements were met for our employees and operations. We ensured adequate supply and stockpiling of PPEs and essential medical equipment for our employees.\n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"6. Physical and mental support:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" These were difficult times for a lot of people — be it the extensive stress or the challenge faced by their loved ones. We ensured that all our employees were provided with physical and mental support to handle their situation. \n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"7. Training and development:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" We provided our employees with adequate training and surveillance on protective practices to ensure they are well prepared to tackle the situation.\n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"8. Special COVID allowance for frontline workers. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n"}},{"contentType":"image","value":{"src":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/28b451402d6a11e9aa979329348d4c3e/cxoroundtablepromo-1615277213243.png"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YS: What were some innovative ideas proposed by employees during the pandemic, and how were they implemented?\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"KR:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" The travel curbs, social distancing norms, and other behaviour changes influenced by the pandemic hastened the adoption of digital technologies in the healthcare sector. \n\nIt forced us to think of new ideas to manage patients and employees and introduce "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"digitised processes. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"This period also made us think outside the box to ensure the same clinical care with lesser manpower and redefined processes. \n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"1. Digital activation:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" Our team came up with ideas to fasten the activation of digital touchpoints for our patients. We launched a mobile app with enhanced features that allowed end-to-end solutions for patients. \n\nFrom teleconsultation with their doctors, to downloading their medical reports, clearing of bills from any part of the world, to several other hospital-related work — most of the provisions have been made on the app. \n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"2. E-learning for referral doctors:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" During the pandemic, there was a lot of confusion about the virus and the protocols that needed to be followed. Hence, it was essential to conduct continuing education for our referral doctors. We created e-learning programmes for our referral doctors and nursing homes to improve their patient care and treatment.\n"}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"Reflection, reframing, resilience – 60 quotes on coping with a crisis","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/28b451402d6a11e9aa979329348d4c3e/Collaboration9-1584437222547.jpg?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2020/03/quotes-crisis-resilience-coronavirus"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"3. We intend to create a work culture where innovation is a part of every employee’s daily activity. \n\nHere are some of the"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":" new processes"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" we follow to enhance the thought process of employees towards innovation.\n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"1. Empowerment:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" The frontline staff are given the authority to be the decision-makers, and undertake a few initiatives that can improve patient care. This allows them to introduce newer ways of enhanced customer experience. \n\nFor instance, if a patient’s baby is crying at the atrium, there are many ways customer care staff can contribute to enhancing the experience of this patient. These ideas can be replicated across our hospital chain,\n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"2. Multi-faceted approach to brainstorming:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" It is certainly true that any new idea is only successful if it is accepted by all the departments with dependencies. We are encouraging people from different teams to come together to brainstorm new ideas, and arrive at a conclusion keeping in mind the challenges faced by other departments. \n"}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"How an uncertain economic environment can be the biggest driver of innovation\n\n","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/f02aced0d86311e98e0865c1f0fe59a2/Untitleddesign-1613375441016.png?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2021/02/uncertain-economic-environment-biggest-driver-innovation"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"3. Fail fast:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" Failure is the key to introduce new and more effective ideas. There is often a fear of failure that inhibits people from trying out new ideas. We encourage our employees to get past their fears, recognise new ideas, and implement them on-ground. \n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"4. Two-way communication:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" To ensure that everyone is heard in the organisation, we have focussed on a two-way flow of communication among all levels. This enhances accessibility and connection among the employees. It also helps them to think differently, understand the end-to-end hospital operations, and introduce more effective ideas.\n"}},{"contentType":"image","value":{"src":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/28b451402d6a11e9aa979329348d4c3e/IC5-1615277294607.png"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"YS:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":" "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"What are your key tips to our audience on how to ensure a healthy culture of debate around innovative suggestions in their organisation?\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"KR: "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"1. Be upbeat and encourage all ideas:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" Many people don’t participate in sharing suggestions due to the fear of rejection, or the possibility of not being appreciated. It is essential to understand the point that the person is trying to make, and work in sync with their thoughts.\n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"2. Don’t make it personal:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" Everyone needs to understand that the core objective of the discussion and debate is for the benefit of the organisation. One needs to focus on how to make the idea more effective during these discussions. This helps in attaining a fruitful outcome.\n\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\u003cb>4. The actor has appeared in several TV commercials and campaigns, and has been known for breaking stereotypes in the Indian television industry. Bold and strong-headed, Pooja was probably one of the very first women to break the rules of the entertainment industry. \n\nThree decades later, 50-year-old Pooja is still applauded for the bold KamaSutra condom campaign she shot in the early 90s to raise awareness of AIDS.\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"In an exclusive interaction with \u003cem>YS Weekender\u003c/em>, the actor says, “I have always lived life on my own terms and conditions. Why did you choose this title for your first book?"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Devir Singh Bhandari (DSB): "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Yuva Bharat"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":" is more than just a book. It does not preach; it ignites the fire within. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"If you ask what \u003cem>Yuva Bharat\u003c/em> means to me, I will say it has been a journey, and my guide and companion on that very journey. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"There is no more relevant time for the title "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Yuva Bharat"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" than today. As the world emerges from COVID-19, so does the realisation that India and its people played the most crucial role in curbing the spread of the pandemic. Given the humongous size of our population and the number of Indians who travel globally, we prevented global numbers from rising by imposing the biggest lockdown in the world. \n\nIn the country where COVID-19 vaccine has been made available at the speed of light, the force of our youth cannot be ignored anymore. And just like Young India, "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Yuva Bharat is about endurance, the strength of human resilience, and beating all odds. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"YS: You are an entrepreneur and now an author. That has been the focus in every endeavour - be it through the movies I have made, the products and services we launched during COVID-19, and our social initiatives. The very act of inspiring positive actions is extremely satisfying. That defines my purpose. \n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"YS: What do you want to achieve with this book? Why did you decide on these stories? "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"DSB:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" The idea behind the book was an extension of who I am as a person and my life experiences. Raised in an Army family, I have travelled across India extensively and seen tales of vigour and fearlessness unfold in front of me. In my weak moments, those stories inspired me to gather my strength and brave it all. That is what gave birth to "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Yuva Bharat"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":". "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"The book wants to remind everyone that the “hero lies in you”."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"YS: Who does "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true,"italic":true},"data":"Yuva Bharat"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":" target?"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"DSB:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" The book is for everyone as there is never any right age or right time for inspiration. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"One day, it broke the ego I never knew I had. Another day, it highlighted fears I had buried long ago.
