And as an entrepreneur, think from your heart; it will always help in the greater good. \n\n \n \n"}}],"timeLapsed":"4th Mar 2021","publishedDate":"March 04, 2021"},{"id":192779,"title":"SonicWall CEO Bill Conner on his journey in the digital and cybersecurity space","slug":"sonicwall-ceo-bill-conner-tech-journey-digital-cybersecurity-covid19","type":"RICH","subtitle":"In a conversation with YourStory, Bill Conner, President and CEO, SonicWall, speaks about his three-decade-long journey in the tech and enterprise sector, and his role in helping governments, municipalities, others with the security of the COVID-19 vaccine distribution process.","publishedAt":"2021-03-01T23:40:00.000Z","updatedAt":"2021-03-03T12:47:19.176Z","brand":{"name":"YourStory","slug":"yourstory","locale":"en_GB","path":"/"},"metadata":{"authors":[{"name":"Sindhu Kashyaap","username":"sindhu-kashyap","order":0,"path":"/author/sindhu-kashyap"}],"category":{"id":359,"name":"Interview","slug":"ys-interview","path":"/category/ys-interview"},"excerpt":"SonicWall CEO Bill Conner speaks about his role in helping governments, municipalities with the security of the COVID-19 vaccine distribution process.","media":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/a9efa9c02dd911e9adc52d913c55075e/Imagebikc-1614576982290.jpg","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/a9efa9c02dd911e9adc52d913c55075e/Imagebikc-1614576982290.jpg","defaultThumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/a9efa9c02dd911e9adc52d913c55075e/Imagebikc-1614576982290.jpg","brandSpotlight":null,"removeAds":null,"sponsoredStory":null,"isRegistrationRequired":false,"timeToRead":10,"tags":[]},"snippets":null,"trailers":null,"path":"/2021/03/sonicwall-ceo-bill-conner-tech-journey-digital-cybersecurity-covid19","featured":true,"mobilePostJson":[{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"In the early 2000s, Bill Conner knew one thing that would be very important in the digital world - "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"digital security"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":". Just before the fateful 9/11 incident, Bill, who was the CEO of Entrust, had briefed NATO, and said: “We’ve learnt how to win wars in the air, land, and sea, but the next war will be cyber, and we are ill-equipped.” \n\nToday, as the President and CEO of SonicWall, a leading network security company, Bill’s work revolves around cybersecurity and malware. With a career spanning more than 30 years across high-tech industries, Bill is one of the most experienced security, data, and infrastructure executives in the world. He has also worked closely with governments, the White House, the Hill, and the NSA, and has built the federal bridge. \n"}},{"contentType":"image","value":{"src":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/a9efa9c02dd911e9adc52d913c55075e/BillConnerPic3-1614577248294.jpg","caption":"\u003cp>Bill Conner \u003c/p>"}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"[Techie Tuesday] Meet Saiman Shetty, who went from a small town near Udupi to building powertrain systems at Tesla ","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/a9efa9c02dd911e9adc52d913c55075e/TechietuesdaySaimanShetty-01-1613389288802.png?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2021/02/techie-tuesday-saiman-shetty-tesla-lyft-autonomous-vehicle-robots-nuro"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"“I also managed to build the first digital passport, and we have done over half the digital passports in the world. We also did national identities and I had to compete with the US government on that,” he says. He also developed a chip with three biometrics for Afghanistan elections in 2007. “This was rewarding personally, he says. I also built an ID card for Interpol, and it was pretty rewarding to work with the Secretary-General,” Bill adds."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"From working at AT&T and Bay Networks to building digital identities with Entrust, re-positioning Silent Circle from a consumer privacy company into an Enterprise Privacy Platform (EPP) to leading security at SonicWall, today Bill is a global leader in security, data, and infrastructure.\n\nEven during the pandemic, Bill has been deeply involved in helping governments, municipalities, etc., to uphold the security of the vaccine distribution process. \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Love for solving problems\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"Hailing from Arkansas, Bill’s love for mathematics and science stemmed from his love for solving problems. He went to the National Youth Science Camp and later joined Princeton University. \n\n“I started working when I was in school and I ran the undergraduate alternative energy lab. This helped me make money to get through school,” he says. \n\nIn the late sixties and early seventies, personal computers were still new, and Bill didn’t have one at home. However, Bill was more interested in Nuclear energy and he joined Princeton as it had the Tokamak reactor, the first fusion reactor. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"While at Princeton, he realised that he still had a lot to learn. “I always \u003cb>believed there would be someone who will be smarter than me\u003c/b>. I enjoyed solving problems, and I really like math and science the most,” says Bill. "}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"[Techie Tuesday] Mike Hearn’s journey: from working on Google Maps and Gmail to building a bitcoin platform ","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/a9efa9c02dd911e9adc52d913c55075e/Techie-Tuesday-8-1612776324701.png?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2021/02/techie-tuesday-mike-hearn-google-maps-gmail-bitcoin-startup-r3"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Climbing the corporate ladder\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"In 1981, Bill joined AT&T’s management development programme. He was one of the only two graduates out of 33 to be an engineer. \n\n“It was pretty cut-throat. We were put in at the managerial level and we had to keep proving ourselves. It was a nine-year programme, and every year, a third of the 33 were asked to leave. After three years, I was one of the two remainings,” says Bill. This made him more aware and more successful as an engineer, and also made him think differently, he adds.\n\nHaving realised the power of digital early on, he started putting out the first digital fibre optics and digital radios for AT&T in 1981. Later, he started directing Bell Labs on some other next-generation compression technology. \n\n“Back in those days, everything was analogue, and I always believed in digital. As a young engineer, I would keep telling that everything is going to be digital,” says Bill. \n\nBill also got an opportunity to work with the AT&T president, and that is when he worked on next-generation development as AT&T was under the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) at that time. \n\n“I showed them how to do a unit cost analysis, and it went on to become my thesis at Wharton. My 150-page thesis was on how to go from regulation and right of return base to activity-based accounting and budgeting, and this was picked up by the Wall Street and the company pivoted around that,” he says. \n\nIn 1987, Bill graduated from Wharton and went back to AT&T headquarters in New Jersey. This is when he got to deploy the first generation digital private network. \n"}},{"contentType":"image","value":{"src":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/a9efa9c02dd911e9adc52d913c55075e/Imagerphd-1614577530879.jpg","caption":"\u003cp>Bill Conner\u003c/p>"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Building the digital world \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"“It was a $100 million contract. Joe Nacchio at AT&T got me into product management and I ran all the long-distance services and private enterprise services. The program was a $5.5 billion income statement, but when I got there, we were losing money and losing market share as well,” explains Bill. \n\nHe went back to Bell Labs and said he was just not prepared for slug brain research, and wanted to do some new products. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"“I told AT&T you have got one year to give me these products or else I'm going to build my own network because, at this point, we were vertically integrated with Western Electric. While they delivered, it was not what I had asked for. So I asked my team to overlay network where I was going to buy Nortel gear instead of AT&T, as it had all the features that my competition had,” explains Bill. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Needless to say, that went up to the Board as they believed I didn’t understand the value of vertical integration. \n\nBill was then asked to lead equipment at AT&T. Recollecting his term, he says, “I'll never forget the first time I walked in there. I got all the union stewards and it was a big luncheon and there were several new people because AT&T realised it needed to turn this factory around. The head of the plant introduced me and said you know nothing about manufacturing, and I looked at him and said that is right and you better up your damn allowance. He started laughing, and from that moment, we became great friends. I realised I was the first person ever to speak to the union.”\n"}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"[Techie Tuesday] Meet the man who went from being a restaurant busboy to heading engineering at OpenText","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/a9efa9c02dd911e9adc52d913c55075e/Techie-Tuesday-1612180690782.png?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2021/02/techie-tuesday-muhi-s-majzoub-opentext"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Joining Nortel and Entrust \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"Bill joined Nortel in 1991. Paul Stern was the CEO of the company, and they were looking for an overhaul. When Bill joined the company, he ran the enterprise side of Nortel, acquired Bay Networks, and led them into the digital world with the IP stack. \n\n“One of our little nuggets there was security. We were doing a lot of business with China, and one of the issues was keeping our data encrypted and protected,” says Bill. \n\nIt was then that they set up Public Key Infrastructure, which was incubated by Bill. It was like a startup with a startup (Entrust), which focussed on software and security. \n\nIn 2000, when the dotcom bubble hit, Bill was roped in full-time to run ‘Entrust’. He worked closely with the government. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"It was during this time he worked with the White House, the Hill, and built the federal bridge. By November 2005, Bill had taken Entrust private and made their first security acquisition. He also played a role in selling the company for six and a half times its original investment. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"From Entrust to SonicWall\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"After Entrust, Bill joined Silent Circle in the early 2000s, where he worked for the black phone and the Silent Circle encrypted app for voice and data. In the early part of 2000, he joined SonicWall. The company had just started working on machine learning (ML), and their CTO, John Gmuender, was building deep learning back in the 90s. \n\n“Having been doing that since the 90s, we had hundreds of thousands of terabytes of malware artefacts. and one of the things our threat networks, which covers about 1.1 million sensors in over 215 countries and territories around the world,” says Bill. \n\n SonicWall today does a lot of work for the US and UK governments, and some countries in Europe as well. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"“Threat data is incredibly valuable in terms of volume content and richness. If you go to the security centre on the website, you can see that data displayed in terms of the type of malware, countries, regions, etc. I got the team to re-architect the products to the cloud, overhaul ingredient technology, and bring it to the current day standards,” says Bill. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Taking security a step further \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"One of the things Bill says he is proud of is one of the interventions called a "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"skunkworks team"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":", which is real-time deep memory inspection (RTDMI). While the data is sent to a sandbox, the malware is super sophisticated and is intelligent enough to see if it’s being watched, recorded, or timed. \n\n“We had to take it a step further on a multi-engine level,” says Bill. “Our firewalls are rated one of the best and they say they're 99 percent effective. That's pretty good, and at Wharton or Princeton, that'd be an A or A+, but in security, that's an F -- at least in my view. We did this multiple engine sandbox and getting through the first three months, our average one percent represents about 1,700 malware a day per customer. At the end of last year, it was 1,200,” says Bill.\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"“The malware is getting so sophisticated that traditional techniques are not going to cut it. We believe this is the only technology that can stop it. We know that's going to be really important as people move to the cloud,” says Bill. "}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"[Techie Tuesday] Robots, ML, Google, YouTube, and more: Meet Branch International’s CTO Benjamin Liebald","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/a9efa9c02dd911e9adc52d913c55075e/TT-25-1611588911712.png?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2021/01/techie-tuesday-robots-ml-google-youtube-branch-cto-benjamin-liebald"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"The power of digital in combating COVID-19\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"Bill’s three-decade-long career has been focussed on digital, and now, with the pandemic, the power of digital has only increased. \n\n“I've been deeply involved with higher education, governments, municipalities, and farmers because countries and states are trying to steal the intellectual property (IP) around these therapeutics and vaccines. Now, they're going into manufacturing, transportation, etc. It's creating a new cyberattack field that has huge value, not just for ransomware, but more importantly, economic welfare and disruption,” adds Bill. \n\nHe says cybercriminals are opening new cyberattack vectors on global deployment and recalibrating their attacks to target the “cold chain” — the supply chain that helps deliver COVID-19 vaccines that need cold temperatures.\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"“To uphold the security of the distribution process, every enterprise, government, and organisation involved needs to be conscious of their digital interactions,” adds Bill. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Today, while hiring, Bill looks for people who are inquisitive, who want to do something different, and think differently. He says integrity and accountability matters a lot. He also advises young engineers to follow their passion. \n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"“Some people love arts, some love hard engineering, and some like marketing - so just follow your passion. I think the most important thing is if you can find something you can get excited about. I am old but I'm still excited. Just follow your heart and your head will follow. Work hard as there’s always going to be someone smarter, but you know no one can outwork you but yourself. I love what I do. If you can embrace it and get excited about it, you'll have a great career and a fun time, no matter what you do.” "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n"}}],"timeLapsed":"2nd Mar 2021","publishedDate":"March 02, 2021"},{"id":191795,"title":"The idea is to bridge the gap between talent and opportunity: Soumini Sridhara Paul of Hungama Artist Aloud","slug":"independent-platform-hungama-artist-aloud-soumini-sridhara-paul","type":"RICH","subtitle":"In a conversation with YS Weekender, Soumini Sridhara Paul, Senior VP of Hungama Artist Aloud, discusses how the platform has evolved over the years, and its content distribution and representation plans.","publishedAt":"2021-02-23T01:00:00.000Z","updatedAt":"2021-02-26T02:33:48.535Z","brand":{"name":"YourStory","slug":"yourstory","locale":"en_GB","path":"/"},"metadata":{"authors":[{"name":"Debolina Biswas","username":"debolina-biswas-1","order":0,"path":"/author/debolina-biswas-1"}],"category":{"id":359,"name":"Interview","slug":"ys-interview","path":"/category/ys-interview"},"excerpt":"Soumini Sridhara Paul, SVP, Hungama Artist Aloud, discusses content distribution and representation plans of the platform. Recently, besides supporting and promoting independent artists, the "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"digital media, distribution and talent management platform"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" forayed into independent content distribution and representation of artists performing in regional languages. \n\nHungama Artist Aloud has now signed up with artists across "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Punjabi, Tamil, Marathi, Bengali, Bhojpuri, and Gujarati"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":" languages. Its lineup includes the likes of Sujeet Sharad Patil, Vishal Srivastav, Tushar Arjun, Savayacrooz Gnanaprabhu, Ashi Tiwari, and Ketan Patel, among others. \n\nCelebrating its 11th anniversary, Hungama Artist Aloud intends to initiate content creation, distribution and artist representation in more regional languages such as Telugu, Kannada, Malayalam, Assamese, Haryanvi, and others. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"In a conversation with \u003cem>\u003cb>YS Weekender\u003c/b>\u003c/em>, Soumini Sridhara Paul, VP of Hungama Artist Aloud says, “I always wanted to build something that would help me give my artists — whom I have known over the years — a chance to put out their content digitally.”"}},{"contentType":"image","value":{"src":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/7/3fb20ae02dc911e9af58c17e6cc3d915/Soumini3-1613993011156.jpg","caption":"\u003cp>\u003cem>Soumini Sridhara Paul, VP of Hungama Artist Aloud\u003c/em>\u003c/p>"}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"We will start recovering from the pandemic from Q2 2021: Sanjeev Kumar Bijli of PVR Ltd","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/7/3fb20ae02dc911e9af58c17e6cc3d915/Imageex5r-1613909739178.jpg?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/weekender/entertainment-industry-sanjeev-kumar-bijli-pvr-cinemas"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"A former musician herself, Soumini has earlier worked with the Universal Music Group and Channel V, and was responsible for bringing in content and interacting with artists. “My experience and knowledge revolved around working with artists and content,” she says. \n\nPost her stint with Channel V, Soumini worked as an Artist Consultant for a few years, trying to figure out how to build a platform to help the artists she knew. It was then that she met "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Neeraj Roy"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":", Founder and CEO of Hungama Digital Media. Soumini presented her idea to Neeraj and started Hungama Artist Aloud, and decided to run the platform. \n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Edited excerpts from the interview: "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"YS Weekender (YSW):"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":" How has the platform changed and developed over the years? \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Soumini Sridhara Paul (SSP):"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":" When we started, we had a website and the intent was to offer distribution for independent artists. I think a lot of that was also on the back of seeing the kind of success that the parent company had with Bollywood and other production content.\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"When I joined the company, Neeraj told me that “You are going to have to run this like an entrepreneur.” At that point, the term Artist Aloud did not even have the name ‘Hungama’ attached to it, in order to differentiate it from the parent company. We were not a label. We were definitely a platform with a democratic approach."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"However, within six months, we realised that the popularity of Bollywood, which was driven by radio and television, was unmatched. The digital touchpoints were not really playing a role in marketing that content. And that is when we realised that we would have to have to create our own media space. So, we started building our Facebook page, YouTube channel, etc. We launched a property called "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"WebCert"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":", which featured the first-ever live streaming concert on the internet. We did WebCert with people like "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Shankar Mahadevan"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":", "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Shilpa Rao"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":","}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":" Himesh Reshammiya"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":", and "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Indian Ocean"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":". The funny thing was we used to do all that just with a dongle. Two years later, we landed up doing larger events."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"We then went into programming for venues and launched IPs like World Music Day in partnership with Hard Rock Cafe, which was, I think, one of the most exciting partnerships we have ever done. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"There are also profiles of a number of startups and tech players in XR.\n\nBased in London, "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Jeremy Dalton"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":" leads PwC's VR/AR team and helps customers understand, quantify and implement the benefits of virtual reality and augmented reality technology.\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"See also \u003cem>\u003cb>YourStory\u003c/b>\u003c/em>\u003cem>’s\u003c/em> \u003ca href=\"https://yourstory.com/tag/bookreview\">\u003cb>Book Review\u003c/b>\u003c/a> section with takeaways from over 290 titles on creativity, entrepreneurship, innovation, social enterprise, and digital transformation. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"It’s not about how new they are, but what they show the technology can do to add value to businesses.\n"}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"How this product manager and musician started a VR startup for digital heritage experiences","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/a09f22505c6411ea9c48a10bad99c62f/Imagel6uv-1608991769751.jpg?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2020/12/virtual-reality-digital-heritage-startup-who-vr-bengaluru"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YS: What is your current field of research in XR?\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"JD: "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"I am supervising a study in collaboration with the University of Bath on the value of virtual reality for job skills simulation (i.e. hard skills). This is being funded by the Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council (EPSRC) and conducted through the Centre for Digital Entertainment (CDE). It is a four-year agreement, and we will hopefully have some exciting initial results over the next 12 months.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YS: One of the interesting examples you mentioned was AR use by NHS during COVID-19. Are there other cases you can cite of how XR can help understand or deal with pandemics?\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"JD:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" Absolutely, let’s take a look at another part of the world: doctors in Taiwan are using virtual reality to learn how to treat coronavirus patients. They can do this at any time without the need for a physical teacher present and can familiarise themselves with the procedure without any risk of harm or transmission of the virus.\n"}},{"contentType":"image","value":{"src":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/28b451402d6a11e9aa979329348d4c3e/Future1-1613647259601.jpg"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YS: How was your book received? What were some of the unusual responses and reactions you got?\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"JD:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" I am very grateful for the interest in "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Reality Check"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":". I’ve had business leaders, XR industry colleagues, and university professors message me and discuss the book on social media. One of the most memorable messages I received is from a professor who runs an XR business: he was very thankful for the book as it gave him the evidence and communication points he needed to sell the technology successfully.\n\nI’ve been surprised by the interest in the book from the XR community as I originally wrote it for business leaders who wanted to know more about the technology, but I am very happy it is proving useful to a wide range of audiences!\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YS: Sites and apps like Instagram have done a lot to make photography accessible to the broad public. Will we see a “killer app” for AR coming out soon? What’s holding it back?\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"JD:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":" The uses of augmented reality are so broad and vast that the concept of a “killer application” makes little sense. It is similar to thinking about the killer application for the internet or a smartphone - these are platforms on which so many solutions and ideas have been built and we are likely to see the same for the medium of AR.\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"What is holding back both VR and AR from becoming mainstream can be summarised by four areas:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Cost "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"- the cheaper it is to access the technology, the greater the uptake we will see.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Content"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" - the more quality content and applications that are available, the more appealing the technology will be.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Education"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" - the more people understand about and become familiar with XR, the more adoption we will see.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Experience"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" - the easier and more comfortable the technology is for people to use, the more people will engage with it.\n\nThe great news is that the XR industry has made incredible strides in all of these areas over the past few years and improvements continue to be made every day, so we will no doubt see upticks in adoption of VR and AR technology.\n"}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"Pros and cons of virtual and augmented learning experiences\n\n","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/f02aced0d86311e98e0865c1f0fe59a2/ar-vr-education-1594614231478.png?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2020/07/pros-cons-virtual-augmented-learning-experiences"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YS: Most XR seems to be B2B or B2C, or intra-organisational. When will we see a truly mass platform or marketplace for consumers to exchange XR content and tools?\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"JD:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" This will depend on when we see mass adoption of XR technology. Recent data places the adoption rate of XR technology at between 6 percent and 16 percent. We should start to see a turning point at about 17 percent adoption so, given the current pace of adoption, it could be less than a few years away!\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YS: What are three key new trends you see in XR as we begin a new year and a new decade?\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"JD:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" Acceleration of mass market adoption of VR: Thanks to the release of inexpensive, standalone headsets like the Oculus Quest 2, consumers are purchasing virtual reality headsets at a faster pace than ever.\n\nProliferation of web-based AR experiences: "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"WebAR,"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" as it’s called, is a technology that allows users to experience augmented reality straight from their web browser, without the need to install any software.\n\nPopularity of volumetric capture technology: "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Volumetric capture technology"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" involves taking thousands of measurements and photos of a person many times a second to create an animated 3D model of that individual that looks real - a “3D video” in summary.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YS: Quite a few startups and large firms are involved in XR now. How should innovators strike that delicate balance between ‘Stick to your vision’ and ‘Adapt to a changed world’?\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"JD:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" Start small and build up with a data-backed business case. If you invest a small amount of money in a new innovation like XR and it doesn’t work, you haven’t lost a lot, and you’ve gained knowledge that you can use in the future. If it does work, you have a business case to implement it more widely in your organisation to create even greater impact and efficiencies.\n"}},{"contentType":"image","value":{"src":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/28b451402d6a11e9aa979329348d4c3e/Perspective-10-1613647398881.png"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YS: How are standards bodies dealing with this emerging medium of XR? What are some challenges and opportunities in this space?\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"JD:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" The British Standards Institution "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"(BSI)"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" as well as other global institutions like the "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"IEC"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" and "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"IEEE "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"have all set up VR/AR working groups to build a common language which benefits everyone in the XR ecosystem from software developers to hardware manufacturers to end users. Some standards organisations like the "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Khronos Group "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"focus on select areas like XR and the standards they’ve created are widely used in the industry today, such as WebGL in WebAR applications and glTF as a file format for 3D models and scenes.\n\nCreating standards for XR is a massive challenge as there are so many "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"underlying and adjacent technologies "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"beneath the surface, many of which need to connect to each other as well as to elements outside the XR How can social entrepreneurs and non-profit organisations make use of your frameworks? You’ve mentioned the Red Cross, are there other examples or potential use cases you’ve come across as well?\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"JD:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" While their business model may be different, social entrepreneurs and non-profit organisations often share many of the same needs as their more corporate brethren: to collaborate effectively remotely, to train on soft skills, and in some cases, to sell physical products, and more. He is also the co-founder of ecommerce platform GOQii. Luke has also been conferred the "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"‘Fit India Champion for Lifestyle and Wellness’ "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"title for the Fit India Movement, an initiative of the Indian government, which was launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in 2019. \n\nHe says that the next big challenge is going to be finding good food. In fact, he has launched Luke’s Wellness Market, an ecommerce platform to meet India’s need for healthy food.\n\nIn an interview with "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true,"italic":true},"data":"YS Weekender"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":", "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Luke discusses his stint as an entrepreneur, holistic wellness, social media and its impact, what stops India from becoming fit, and much more.  \n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Edited excerpts from the interview."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YS Weekender [YSW]: How did you jump into entrepreneurship?\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Luke Coutinho [LC]: "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"I started as a nutritionist and then moved into lifestyle because I felt that nutrition alone cannot fix the health problems that we have in the world. Doctors treat symptoms, nutritionists teach people how to eat food. \n\nBut the biggest issue is the overall lifestyle and the biggest gap is every expertise in the healthcare space is working in their own silos. Everything is fragmented. So, I moved into integrative and lifestyle medicine as well because I wanted to put everything together. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Today, when patients come to us, they get treated with the right \u003cb>nutrition, medicine, sleeping habits, emotional wellness techniques\u003c/b>, and exercises that suit them. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"We have built our businesses based on not just helping them fix their diseases but also their lives. \n\nThen, we realised that if food is medicine then the next biggest challenge would be where to get good food from? From your experiences, what have you been able to gather about holistic well being and lifestyle?\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"LC: "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"When we talk about holistic wellness of a person, it's the way you eat, the time you eat, the quality of your food and whether the exercise you do is suiting you or not. He joined Ness in 2020. \n"}},{"contentType":"image","value":{"src":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/a9efa9c02dd911e9adc52d913c55075e/Ranjit-Tinaikar-1613303779153.png"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"Edited excerpts from the interview:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"YourStory (YS):Tell us about your journey and early days of your career? What brought you to Ness"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"?\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Ranjit Tinaikar (RT):"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" I have been fortunate enough to have found opportunities that made my professional journey a series of s-curves of learning. Each s-curve began with a bit of risk-taking with something new and unfamiliar, then rapid learning with eventual plateauing as one figures it out – which is usually the time for the next s-curve. The risk-taking and consequent learning and growth is something that I have always found exciting. \n\nSome of these s-curves involved changes in career paths as I moved from being a software engineer at Citibank, to becoming a professor doing research in social networks at Carnegie Mellon University, to becoming a business consultant at McKinsey, to operating businesses in data and analytics at Thomson Reuters, and Fitch more recently. \n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"I found the next s-curve when I moved from being a newly elected partner at McKinsey in the US to work in Asia – very different markets and client needs.  "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"\n\nMy new role at Ness does feel like going back to my roots in software engineering, but it is definitely a new s-curve for me and just as thrilling as my first job. Ness has always been known for its prowess in product engineering; it is but now poised for growth as technology disruption in cloud, data, and ML/AI increases. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"The pandemic has only accelerated the digital transformation of our customers. Joining Ness is especially thrilling as we aim to take the company on its next s-curve.  "}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"[YS Learn] The most exciting days are ahead of us: Sanjot Malhi of Matrix Partners India on the rise of consumer tech","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/a9efa9c02dd911e9adc52d913c55075e/Image56u5-1613030016298.jpg?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2021/02/ys-learn-exciting-days-ahead-matrix-partners-india-sanjot-malhi-consumer-tech"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"YS: How are industries changing? What type of digital transformation efforts are companies focusing on?"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":" \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Over the last 10 years, artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML), blockchain, cloud platforms, and data and analytics have been disrupting the way businesses engage customers, manage supply chains, and operate their internal processes. The pandemic has only accelerated this trend. \n\nI think that we have accelerated the digital transformation of existing businesses by nearly five to seven years, as the time has never been better for rethinking the way we work in a digital ecosystem – for once the customers, suppliers, employees, and investors are working differently. It is the "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"perfect confluence to drive change"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":".\n\nI think digital transformation is based on design thinking. But is design thinking necessary for innovation?  \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Design thinking and innovation are two sides of the same coin, but all too often, design thinking is boiled down to the user interface or user experience teams, and their ability to design a website or application. \u003cb>At Ness, we believe that design thinking is about building solutions that start with the end customer’s need. \u003c/b>"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Innovation comes from serving the needs of customers in ways that you have not before. To do this properly, it is critical for a digital engineering firm to ask the following questions to keep design thinking top of mind:\n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Do I understand the domain of the customer? "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"The needs of a customer walking into an auto dealership to buy a car are very different from those of someone walking into a hospital for medical treatment. Engineers developing products for these organisations are going to need to understand the business needs, services, markets, and regulatory challenges of the kind of domain they are working in. \n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Do I understand what the customer needs, as opposed to what they say they want? "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"The only way you can bring innovation is by viewing the path forward from the customer’s perspective to understand what they really want. Skilled engineers are able to use a variety of skills, services, and techniques that enable innovative design in a way that simple UX or UI design does not allow for. \n"}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"[YS Learn] ‘We are focused on helping India transform into a digitally empowered society’\r\n","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/a9efa9c02dd911e9adc52d913c55075e/1Dirk-PetervanLeeuwen-1612763745993.jpg?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2021/02/ys-learn-india-digital-open-source-red-hat"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"YS: Tell us about Ness' growth and future global plans, business strategy, and roadmap for 2021"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" . "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":" \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"RT: "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"For"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":" "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Ness, the 2021 roadmap begins first and foremost with an effort to double down on what we are really good at: building customer-facing platforms and software products. Over time, we have evolved from bringing software to software companies to enabling enterprises to thrive in the digital economy. \n\nMany organisations are not fully satisfied by standard services. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Businesses are increasingly looking for their own unique platforms to maximise their competitive advantage"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":", which is where we come in. \n\nWe have had the privilege of having long-running and deep-standing relationships with our customers. Innovation is a never-ending process, so we are committed to improving our understanding of these partners to provide ongoing value. To make this actionable, our key priorities are investing and building out our focus in engineering, doubling down on our relationships, over-investing in our skills in data, cloud, machine learning, and engaging our customers in a verticalised way.\n\nAs a result of this plan, Ness has already seen tremendous success in the last year, and is well positioned for growth in 2021. We have already seen 2x the growth from last year for Q4, and expect to see 3x the growth in 2021. \n\nNess has product engineering in its DNA – an integrated discipline that focuses on solving problems for the modern business and enabling success in a virtual economy. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Digital acceleration is not just a theory; I see it playing out in our performance at Ness."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n"}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"[YS Learn] India has seen the second-highest users of Webex outside of the US during the pandemic - Ritesh Doshi, Enterprise Networking, Cisco India and SAARC\n","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/a9efa9c02dd911e9adc52d913c55075e/Imagejcbg-1611486061453.jpg?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2021/01/ys-learn-india-webex-pandemic-cisco-ritesh-doshi-saarc"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"YS: How did Ness react to the COVID-19 situation? Any plans to normalise the workplace in 2021"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"?\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"RT: At Ness, we continue to take many proactive steps to protect the people who make up our company - our employees and their families, and our customers and their families. Safety is, of course, our top priority, but we are also committed to "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"maintaining the high-quality customer service that clients have come to expect from Ness"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":".\n\nBecause of the nature of our business, we had many procedures in place already to ensure that "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"creativity and collaboration continued in the virtual world"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":". As a provider of digital engineering services from locations in North America, Europe, and India, we have been perfecting a form of globally distributed agile development we call "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Flexshoring "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"for the last 20 years. \n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Our team’s digital interactions are so frequent that the channels through which we work have become instinctual, and working hours across multiple time zones is part of the company’s DNA. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Additionally, our customers continue to face their own challenges during the pandemic. To meet the technological needs of clients, Ness’s rapid response team members actively contribute creative ideas and reach out at a senior level to offer additional support where needed. This is conducted in the spirit of friendly and essential cooperation because we value our long-standing customer relationships.\n\nLooking ahead, in 2021, the health and safety of our employees remains a top priority. Ness will continue to monitor guidance from our respective regional governments and health authorities with respect to returning to the workplace. However, with a strong, productive virtual environment and constant client communication, we’re confident that "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Ness can continue growing, innovating and collaborating with customers as the pandemic continues"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":". \n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":3},"data":"YS: What are Ness India’s plans and your views on startups?\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"RT:"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":" India has always been a global hub for talent. Our recruitment in the last quarter has gone up by 20 percent in the country. At Ness, we want to "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"continue building a very distinctive brand for talent acquisition in India"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":". \n\nThere is a whole new generation of Indians who want to be on the cutting edge of solving problems and designing innovative solutions. They also want to have access to training and learning environments where they can gain new skills – not just in new technologies, but new domains. Finally, they want to get back to high mobility and growth.\n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"We are focusing on serving these growing needs in India. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"One of the significant steps was extending capital gains exemption by one more year (through 31 March 2022), and excluding startups for one more year, to claim tax holiday. To now make up for that and progress further on your own financial awareness, we refer to three important steps. Getting a better understanding of "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"earning"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":", "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"spending"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":", and "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"investing "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"goes hand in hand with good financial decisions. \n\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"First, it’s always prudent to take stock of where you are currently. Look at all your earnings from the company you work in, as well as from other sources. See if your job is secure, if you would like to look for a change, or choose something else as a career. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Second"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":", the pandemic-induced physical and social restrictions have catalyzed various economic repercussions globally. It might have resulted in a substantial cut in a consumer’s spending prowess. The arrival of vaccines is seeding the ideas of revenge spending and revenge tourism in people’s minds. How quickly can they get out and do something, buy something, travel anywhere! \n\nBut in such a climate, though it is essential for people to treat themselves and splurge a bit, we recommend being on guard and cautiously maintaining expenditure. After all, your savings are nothing but your potential blueprint for further investment and expansion.\n\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"bold":true},"data":"Third"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":", chances are you are not spending too much, and general expenses have been low in the last one year, probably because of varied reasons like living with family; not eating out; not spending on shopping, movies, restaurants, etc. It’s a good idea to now figure out what to do with the money you have inadvertently saved. \n\nWe see the stock market has been doing extraordinarily well. If you are a conservative risk taker in investing, there are other asset classes that might interest you, like real estate, which might eventually do well. \n\nIf you are a high flyer in terms of risk appetite but have been sitting on the sidelines, you can choose to learn something about stock market investing and grow your money there, after keeping some aside as a nest egg. \n\nHere are some more best practices for financial management and risk neutralization in the new normal:\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Budget planning\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"This is the most basic and significant aspect of financial hygiene. Planning a budget may sound like an additional step and tedious to some. But listing all expenses can help you understand your spending patterns and draw up a forecasting a budget for, say, the next month that is more accurate for your lifestyle and needs. This goes a long way in having an impact on your overall financial health. \n\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"A planned budget can help you figure out what you can buy and how much you can save. You can also understand the flow of your expenses and make realistic spending and buying targets. This is the first step towards a planned and secure financial future. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Cut down on expenditure\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Once you plan a budget, you can trace your expenditures and cut down on those that you can and feel like doing so. What most people don’t realize is that most of the spending can be significantly reduced even by making a few small lifestyle changes.\n\nWe inadvertently end up spending on things that are less important and which can be reduced or avoided completely. Although this requires a little discipline, it goes a long way. \n"}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"Is the lockdown a perfect opportunity to talk about family finances?\n\n","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/f02aced0d86311e98e0865c1f0fe59a2/family-finances-1591241647778.png?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2020/06/lockdown-perfect-opportunity-talk-family-finances"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Pay your debts\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"If you have any credit card bills piling up and debts, you should take the necessary measures to repay those as soon as you can. Accumulating debt or not paying back on time can have consequences on your credit score. \n\nPaying the bare minimum to the credit card company every month is all right if you are in a dire financial crunch in a particular month, but know that this doesn’t work in the long run. Because this is what the credit card company wants you to do, as they can then charge you very high rates of interest on the money that is yet to be paid. \n\nA planned budget can help you get rid of your cumulative debt. A sound idea is to trim your credit card debt using any funds you have. A low credit score will also affect your loan potential; if you are in debt, the chances of getting a loan are really low. \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Use debt relief programmes cautiously\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"If your credit card debt has already spiralled out of control, you can consider using debt relief programmes, which include debt settlement firms and consumer credit counselling services. These services help you by negotiating debt settlement terms, so you don’t have to pay as much as you owe.\n\nThey also help you plan debt management and provide budget advice to manage your finances. This entails you choosing not to pay your creditors, thus effectively harming your credit scores. It is advisable to use these programmes safely to ensure that your credit score remains good.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Monitor your credit score \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"If you have a low credit score, you don’t qualify for low-interest loans. Keeping your credit score high is essential for good financial hygiene. Therefore, you should monitor all your credit cards and keep the score high by paying instalments on time and cutting down on unnecessary expenditure. You can also check your credit score for free using any of the online available apps today on different credit bureaus; this will help you monitor your credit score.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Avoid scammers\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Financial scams have become common nowadays and even educated people fall victim to them. Please don’t blame yourself, as most people are unaware of all the terms and conditions that fall under financial security. The best way to avoid them is by educating yourself about who is regulated by government bodies and who have all licences in place. \n\nCustomers need to be able to tell the difference between regulated lenders and people who might be frauds. The Reserve Bank of India has released the list of companies that are regulated to lend. With some fintech players that might not have registered as a non-banking financial company offering financial services, please read all terms and conditions carefully before using their platforms. \n\nA proper know-your-customer (KYC) process, income proofs are a must for all regulated lenders and hence, making sure that is done is a safe point on your checklist as a consumer. \n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Final word\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Financial hygiene is essential for survival. Most people are unaware that basic financial practices are the key to a secure future. Your savings will help you in times of crises. Hence, it is important to understand that no income is disposable, all your money is hard earned, and you should take good care of it. Only the capital that is saved can be utilized for further expansion and investment purposes. Managing your expenses and spending wisely can help you build a better, more sustainable future.\n"}}],"timeLapsed":"19th Mar 2021","publishedDate":"March 19, 2021"},{"id":190564,"title":"On-demand logistics is set to transform the delivery experience\n\n","slug":"on-demand-logistics-transform-delivery-experience","type":"RICH","subtitle":"On-demand logistics has become a buzzword in the pandemic-ridden world. The day is not far off when it will enable deliveries by drones within 30 minutes of orders being placed online.\n\n","publishedAt":"2021-03-18T17:16:59.317Z","updatedAt":"2021-03-19T04:09:06.941Z","brand":{"name":"YourStory","slug":"yourstory","locale":"en_GB","path":"/"},"metadata":{"authors":[{"name":"Santosh Desai","username":"santoshdesai","order":0,"path":"/author/santoshdesai"}],"category":{"id":1044,"name":"Opinion","slug":"opinion","path":"/category/opinion"},"excerpt":"On-demand logistics has become a buzzword in the pandemic-ridden world. The day is not far off when it will enable deliveries by drones within 30 minutes of orders being placed online.","media":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/f02aced0d86311e98e0865c1f0fe59a2/on-demand-logistics-1613148125634.png","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/f02aced0d86311e98e0865c1f0fe59a2/on-demand-logistics-1613148125634.png","defaultThumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/f02aced0d86311e98e0865c1f0fe59a2/on-demand-logistics-1613148125634.png","brandSpotlight":null,"removeAds":null,"sponsoredStory":null,"isRegistrationRequired":false,"timeToRead":4,"tags":[]},"snippets":null,"trailers":null,"path":"/2021/02/on-demand-logistics-transform-delivery-experience","featured":false,"mobilePostJson":[{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"On-demand logistics has evolved significantly in the past few years and has become an industry buzzword, with its increasing relevance in today’s pandemic-ridden world.\n\nAdopting on-demand logistics offers several advantages over traditional logistics, with lower operational cost and green footprint among the most appealing ones. The extensive use of digital technology, paperless invoicing, and effective delivery mechanisms are more such feasible factors that improve both the outcomes and the overall process.\n\nThird-party logistics (3PL) providers are embracing the gig economy to deliver high-quality on-demand services with a mobile-first approach and technology being core to all operations.\n\nRobotics has also emerged as an important feature in today’s logistics ecosystem, but the need for manpower still exists when it comes to tasks involving judgement and critical thinking. Hence, gig workers have turned on-demand logistics into a great match for 3PL providers.\n"}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"[YS Learn] Blowhorn: How they got venture capitalist Tim Draper to invest in the team \n","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/a9efa9c02dd911e9adc52d913c55075e/blowhorn-final-1590481399966-1591274805190.png?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2020/06/ys-learn-blowhorn-venture-capitalist-tim-draper-tesla-spacex"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Challenges and growth opportunities\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"India continues to face several challenges in traditional logistics processes that are still prevalent in many parts of the country. These challenges include higher total cost of ownership, excessive paperwork, and unreliable/unpredictable service-level agreements (SLA) for deliveries.\n\nMost importantly, traditional logistics is asset-heavy, which leads to either heavy wear and tear on assets to achieve utilisation of key performance indicators or under-utilisation in the event of fluctuating demands.\n\nThese challenges combined with varying consumer expectations have paved the way for on-demand logistics providers to revolutionise the delivery experience. \n\nOn-demand logistics today strives to provide end consumers, even in Tier-II and Tier-III cities, with "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"italic":true},"data":"same-day delivery"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":" of a wide spectrum of goods ranging from groceries to consumer electronic products.\n\nEven during the challenging times of a global pandemic, the logistics industry has worked round the clock to deliver above and beyond the SLAs expected.\n\nLast-mile logistics has now entered a new era, with the same-day delivery experience no longer limited to essential goods and with convenience emerging as a key customer tenet.\n\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"The existence of speedy logistics has enabled growth for several micro, small and medium enterprises by delivering goods on the same day to end customers. The benefits of integrating one’s business with a third-party logistics provider have thus become pivotal today to ensuring lower costs and higher performances."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\nOn-demand logistics services are, therefore, imperative for up-and-coming ecommerce platforms among other small and medium enterprises for delivering goods in a reliable and seamless manner.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Key to customer-centric logistics\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"The major differentiating factor between traditional and on-demand logistics is the elevated level of convenience available with these services.\n\nCompetitive as they are, on-demand delivery services empower customers to select from a variety of service providers, easily enter important details such as pickup and delivery date, time, and location. These platforms also provide greater visibility into the supply chain with real-time tracking of goods and packages.\n\nThis is a twofold benefit as it not only allows consumers to keep track of their orders but also allows suppliers to examine their processes and look for areas of improvement.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"On-demand logistics: The Future of Retail\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"On-demand services will continue to be significant in the near future as we witness the setting up of various 3PL warehouses in developing nations.\n\nWith on-demand delivery becoming the new norm as many businesses try to establish an omnichannel presence, the future of retail is its transformation into local fulfilment centres as opposed to sparse brick-and-mortar stores.\n\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"The future will also see an exponential increase in leveraging innovative solutions such as the usage of computer vision technology like augmented reality, drones, blockchain technology, self-driving trucks, and artificial intelligence-powered robots to fully automate processes and achieve maximum efficiency."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\nOn-demand startups continue to capture the attention of investors and venture capital funds as they are the key enablers of such a progressive model. According to freight forwarding company Globetrotters Ltd, there will be remarkable changes within the logistics landscape. Hyperlocal transportation with sub-hour deliveries is now being experimented with the usage of autonomous vehicles and drones.\n\nThe day is not far off when one will order a product online and have art."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\n\nA fund manager is a professional appointed by a client to invest and manage their portfolio. The role of a fund manager is to protect the interests of clients, deliver the approach committed and put in the best effort to reach the goal agreed.\n\nTechnology does not change the primary tenet of either who is a manager, or what are they supposed to do. It helps improve the relationship by making it more objective, transparent, and efficient.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"More objective investing\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"Study after study has shown the deep biases that impact even the most expert investors. Humans are emotional and biased decision-makers. They can and must use technology to augment these blind spots.\n\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Data availability has exploded over the last two decades. This means asset managers have big data available to use in natural language processing, image recognition, and machine learning to analyse and uncover new investment insights."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\nHowever, technology is only as successful as the person harnessing it. Therefore, fund managers need to upskill and prepare for a brave new world where they need to work with machines for product creation and alpha generation.\n\nIt is, in fact, their fiduciary duty to rely on tools more objective than them to help their clients achieve their goals.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Deeper, transparent client relationships\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"In the US alone, $68 trillion of wealth is going to be transferred to millennials from their parents in the next 25 years. How do you cut through the noise?\n\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Technology allows managers to understand their clients better, and build/customise products that work for them. As ETFs and technology become more ubiquitous, costs will inevitably shrink. This means managers need to relook at their business models, get rid of the buffet of products and rationalise to a few profitable ones.\n\nSimilarly, managers will need to overhaul their cost structures for unit economics to make sense. Make changes to people, operations, and processes to allow for fee structures that are far lower than what they are used to today. The intercity market, however, hasn’t seen a similar growth story. \n\nAlthough road travel is the most flexible means of commuting due to depth of infrastructure, choice of destinations, and level of journey customisation, affordability and convenience, especially for hauls of 200-300 km and above, its growth hasn’t kept up.\n\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"The new-age, digitally savvy Indian commuter has a fast-rising disposable income, albeit with COVID headwinds, and expects a connected experience in all spheres of life, be it entertainment, lifestyle, food delivery, ecommerce, education, work or travel and transportation. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\nAdd to this, rapid urbanisation, and demand for state-of-the-art travel is only going to rise. This is where technology comes in as a mediator between rising commuter expectations and the most prominent facilitator of intercity transportation, buses.\n"}},{"contentType":"alsoRead","value":{"title":"[The Turning Point] How a bitter travel experience led this entrepreneur to start intercity travel startup Yolobus","thumbnail":"https://images.yourstory.com/cs/2/79900dd0d91311e8a16045a90309d734/TP2-1594986403026.png?fm=png&auto=format&h=100&w=100&crop=entropy&fit=crop","publishedUrl":"https://yourstory.com/2020/07/turning-point-intercity-bus-startup-travel-yolobus"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Availability and inclusion\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"India has a large and diverse base of bus travellers, a segment that has stayed largely offline. Those who are digitally savvy in almost all other spheres of consumption have selectively stayed away from migrating online for intercity services due to deep-rooted pain points in the industry, stemming primarily from lack of reliability.\n\nThe Indian consumer base varies across the board — age, education, lifestyle, and spending patterns. Serving a group-level personalised yet scalable delivery model therefore becomes key to excelling.\n\nSo, while someone travelling from Delhi to Chandigarh expects a comfortable journey at any hour of the day, a commuter from Agra to Gorakhpur would prefer an affordable option in most cases.\n\nBus operations in India have largely remained fragmented, with a few operators dominating their respective regions due to the asset-intensive nature of the business and lack of investment in technology. \n\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Understanding the needs of partners and translating those into a suite of mobility apps to not only focus on booking and reservation management, but also include softer aspects of process controls is something we look to technology for. "}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\nSome examples of the latter are real-time tracking and alerts and financial tools that optimise for asset utilisation, scheduling, and inventory management for the operator.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"Connected and personalised experience\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"data":"From the customer’s perspective, availability, timeliness, and experience (cleanliness, comfort, and hygiene) should flow simultaneously. Technology plays an important role in how these attributes can be delivered reliably across all touchpoints on a typical customer journey. \n\n"}},{"contentType":"blockquote","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Contactless online and offline checkouts, live tracking, in-bus Wi-Fi, real-time boarding/deboarding alerts and notifications are some features being offered today. Technology and customer experience are correlated."}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"\nTechnology can help providers gather and personalise their customers’ experiences based on past behaviour, choices, and purchase history. It helps in understanding their needs and building long-term relationships with them. When you use technology to collect and streamline customer feedback and preferences to feed these back into your services, you’ve already solved half the problems.\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{"header":2},"data":"The data advantage\n"}},{"contentType":"text","value":{"formats":{},"data":"Travelling patterns of consumers are getting less predictable. Choices change every day depending on occasion, purpose, weather, and even the health of travellers. To address this, we see a need to build a higher degree of flexibility in our offerings for customers. Here again, technology helps because we are talking of gigantic amounts of data that need to be gathered, analysed, understood, and then used to improve services. \n\nAnd not just customers’ data, but also providers’ data. What this does is it enables operators to become better at delivering on-the-go demands, keep flexibility as a constant offering, and become trustworthy in the long run.\n\nTo sum it up, the intercity travel landscape in India is at an interesting and challenging juncture. While there will obviously be some trial and error, this must be considered an opportunity.
